decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The land around the existing telecommunications installation shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the proposed installation to the satisfaction of the local planning authority.  Reason: To prevent unnecessary clutter in the area in the interest of the appearance of the locality in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8 and 4.13 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2011). | The approved telecommunications equipment cabinet shall be removed from the site and the land made good to the satisfaction of the local planning authority when it becomes redundant.  Reason: To prevent unnecessary clutter in the area in the interest of the appearance of the locality in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8 and 4.13 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2011).
description: Installation of a BT Telecommunications DSLAM equipment cabinet measuring 800mm x 1300mm x 450mm (Application for Prior Approval)
